byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

abstract: Among the more unusual supporters of AT&T's $39 billion deal for T-Mobile USA is the Shreveport-Bossier Rescue Mission, a Louisiana homeless shelter.
snippet: Among the more unusual supporters of AT&T's $39 billion deal for T-Mobile USA is the Shreveport-Bossier Rescue Mission, a Louisiana homeless shelter.
lead_paragraph: Among the more unusual supporters of AT&T's $39 billion deal for T-Mobile USA is the Shreveport-Bossier Rescue Mission, a Louisiana homeless shelter. "It is important that we, as Christians, never stop working on behalf of the underserved and forgotten," R. Henry Martin, the director of the charity, wrote in a letter to the Federal Communications Commission endorsing the deal. (Left unsaid was the $50,000 donation AT&T gave to the mission.) Read more »
